N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 172.3 - Notice of criminal conviction

State Regulations

Any watch, guard or patrol agency licensee or any licensed
private investigator, or any licensed bail enforcement agent or any registered
security guard who is convicted of a crime as defined in the Penal Law in this

State or an offense which would constitute a crime in New York in any other
state or Federal or foreign jurisdiction, shall give notice of such conviction
to the Department of State, Division of Licensing Services, at its Albany

Office, by certified mail, return receipt requested, within 10 days from date
of conviction. Such notice shall be given notwithstanding pendency of
appeal. Notes
